content:
Sure, here are some expanded versions of the previous statements:

1. I often prioritize my personal goals over team goals, even if it means sacrificing team success.
2. I tend to shy away from taking initiative or leading projects because of fear of failure.
3. I have a tendency to procrastinate on important tasks and assignments.
4. I sometimes react emotionally or impulsively in difficult situations instead of taking a step back and analyzing the situation objectively.
5. I am not always proactive in seeking out opportunities to learn and grow professionally.
6. I sometimes fail to communicate effectively with my team members, leading to misunderstandings or conflicts.
7. I struggle to adapt to changing circumstances and may become resistant to change.
8. I sometimes put off difficult conversations or conflict resolution, which can lead to unresolved issues within the team.
9. I tend to rely too heavily on my own opinions and ideas, rather than seeking input and feedback from my team members.
10. I have a tendency to play it safe and avoid taking risks, even if it means missing out on potential opportunities.
